message_1: What are the products formed when aqueous solutions of potassium iodide and lead(II) nitrate are mixed together? Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction and identify the type of double replacement reaction that takes place.
message_2:
When aqueous solutions of potassium iodide (KI) and lead(II) nitrate (Pb(NO3)2) are mixed together, a double replacement reaction occurs, resulting in the formation of lead(II) iodide (PbI2) and potassium nitrate (KNO3).

The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 KI (aq) + Pb(NO3)2 (aq) â†’ PbI2 (s) + 2 KNO3 (aq)

This is a type of precipitation reaction, as lead(II) iodide (PbI2) forms a solid precipitate when the two solutions are mixed.
